lyrics.lyrics: I wanna hold the hand inside you
I wanna take the breath that's true
I look to you and I see nothing
I look to you to see the truth
You live your life, you go in shadows
You'll come apart and you'll go blind
Some kind of night into your darkness
Colors your eyes with what's not there
Fade into you
Strange, you never knew
Fade into you
I think it's strange you never knew
A stranger's light comes on slowly
A stranger's heart without a home
You put your hands into your head
And then smiles cover your heart
Fade into you
Strange, you never knew
Fade into you
I think it's strange you never knew
Fade into you
Strange, you never knew
Fade into you
I think it's strange you never knew
I think it's strange you never knew

annotation: This line, together with the alternating “I think it’s strange…” line references the disbelief of the singer, whose emotional connection is so strong that she wants to “fade into” the object of her desire/obsession, yet the object of that desire is oblivious to the depth of her feelings. Unrequited love in its purest form.

Unrequited love in its purest form.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
You’ll come apart and you’ll go blind
 Some kind of night into your darkness
annotation: The “night"This phrase can be interpreted as describing a transition or merging of two states of being—night and darkness—both of which are often associated with mystery, introspection, and sometimes sadness.The state of two consciousnesses and emotional turmoil.The state of two consciousnesses and emotional turmoil.might suggest an  attempt to connect with someone who is emotionally distant or troubled. The “night

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics: You live your life, you go in shadows
annotation: the person being referenced “goes in shadows” referring to their mystery, emphasising previous lines that she wants to get to know them but “shadows” creates an imagery of being hidden and wanting to remain unknown, despite her desperate attempts to know them.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
You put your hands into your head
 And then its smiles cover your heart
annotation:
“Put your hands into your head” could be a literal way to oddly describe the sort of sulking, head-in-hands position people often take when stressed or crying.



It also mirrors the opening line of the first verse, which speaks about their partner having a hand inside themselves. The hands could represent a physical sign of affection that they are overriding with second thoughts; the speaker has to “hold the hand inside” them because their hands are in their head.

“It’s smiles cover your heart” also implies that this person’s true feelings are difficult to read. In one line they seem like they are sad, but the next they are smiling. Their true intentions are masked.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
A stranger light comes on slowly
 A stranger’s heart without a home
annotation:
As this partner is drifting away from the speaker, they are slowly becoming a stranger to them.

This partner’s feelings towards the speaker are described as a “stranger’s heart without a home.” Meaning, they’ve never reciprocated affection with the speaker, love itself was a “stranger” in their relationship. Thus, their relationship never had a commitment or “home.”

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics: Colors your eyes with what’s not there
annotation: The speaker is again disappointed and dissatisfied with what they have found out about this person, so they create their own results or truth about them. To involve the idea of colouring their eyes, a very delicate and unique body part, suggests they are adding intimate and personal details to their perception of this person.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics:
I look to you and I see nothing
 I look to you to see the truth
annotation:
This connects to the previous line where they emphasize truth. The speaker has turned to this partner several times, but can only get the bare minimum and fail to learn anything about the person.

Although they want to feel like they’re connected and in love, they feel ‘nothing’ when they look at them. Thus “the truth” simultaneously represents something they want from their partner and the realization that their partner doesn’t really care for them.

lyricsAnnotations.lyrics: I wanna take the breath that’s true
annotation:
The speaker wants to learn everything about the partner and get a deeper connection to them; they want to hear them speak true, personal words.

“Take the breath that’s true” could also be a roundabout way of saying that this person is “truly breathtaking.”

sections.explanation: The first verse starts with delicate vocals expressing a longing and introspection.
The chorus introduces the main theme of 'Fade Into You,' with its poignant and emotional expression.
The second verse begins, continuing the introspective narrative of longing and connection.
The final repetition of the chorus brings the song to its emotional climax, emphasizing themes of unreciprocated love.

song_start.explanation: The song begins with a soft and melodic intro, setting the overall mood with gentle instrumentation.

song_end.explanation: The song concludes with an instrumental outro, fading gently into silence.
